offset.description: number of bytes to skip from the beginning of the binary buffer (e.g. useful to describe 'legacy' buffer that have a header. Default=`0`)

position.description: Vertex positions relative to Oriented-bounding-box center

uv0.description: First set of UV coordinates (textured mesh only)

uvRegion.description: UV regions (for repeated textures in texture atlases)

compressedAttributes.description: Compressed attributes. **Cannot** be combined with any other attributes

enum-description.east-north-up: normals are stored in a node local reference frame defined by the easting, northing and up directions at the OBB/MBS center, and is only valid for geographic(WGS84)
enum-description.earth-centered: normals are stored in a global earth-centered, earth-fixed (ECEF) reference frame where the x-axis points towards Prime meridian (lon = 0�) and Equator (lat = 0�), the y-axis points East towards lon = +90 and lat = 0 and the z-axis points North. It is only valid for geographic
enum-description.vertex-reference-frame: normals are stored in the same reference frame as vertices and is only valid for projected spatial reference

normalReferenceFrame.description: Frame of reference for normals. default is `earth-centered` for GCS (geographic), and `vertex-reference-frame` for PCS (projected)
